reporting_cycle: The Panel of Experts to provide a final report no later than 30 days prior to termination of its mandate
summary: The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions and statements on Sudan, and the 30 March 2011 interim report by the Panel of Experts, determines that the situation in Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII, it reaffirms previous measures, extends the Panel of Experts' mandate until 19 February 2012, and requests the Secretary-General to take necessary administrative measures. The Panel is to provide a final report with findings and recommendations no later than 30 days prior to its mandate's termination. The Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
